results.title: When deaf minds travel
results.brief_description: Much is written and discussed about the mental health challenges for the deaf community, but rarely do we hear from those directly dealing with these challenges. This project was produced in partnership with VicDeaf.
results.description: Much is written and discussed about the mental health challenges for the deaf community, but rarely do we hear from those directly dealing with these challenges. This project was produced in partnership with VicDeaf.

results.title: Weekends in the country
results.brief_description: Born in the country but forced to live in a hostel for the deaf in Melbourne from a very young age, William talks about his isolation, depression and separation from family. This is a tragic story reflecting the lack of facilities and support for the deaf in rural Victoria. With Auslan signing and subtitles.

results.title: TV subtitles
results.brief_description: Angry and frustrated when a hotel did not provide tv’s with tv suibtitles, Robert took matters into his own hands to fight for the rights of people with special needs. With Auslan signing and subtitles.

results.title: Strong Woman
results.brief_description: Meg tells her story of heartbreak, isolation, depression and her eventual healing and rebuilding, of taking control and regaining her life. With Auslan signing and subtitles only.

results.title: What do you think about getting what you're after
results.creator_credit: Gundrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “What Do You Think”.
This film invites discussion of whether, in business competition, one’s standards of fair play should be lowered. The question revolves around two young women who seek the same job. While one has already applied for the position and is reasonably sure of getting it, she lessens her chances by telling the other that applications are still being accepted. A third woman questions the first’s “softness” and the audience is asked to judge. No. 6 in the series.
results.title_for_label: What do you think about getting what you’re after
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gundrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Choosing a leader
results.creator_credit: Julia Murphy, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “What Do You Think”.
An open-ended discussion film for teenaged groups dealing with the problem of choosing a leader. The story concerns a group of boys and girls hiking in the woods, facing the possibility of being lost. One boy, always highly admired because of his athletic prowess, wants to take one direction; another boy, with considerable logic on his side, wants to take the other. What are the factors the group must take into consideration in deciding whose leadership to choose? The question is left with the film audience.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julia Murphy, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Being different
results.creator_credit: Julia Murphy, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “What Do You Think”.
Departing from the norm, from accepting patterns of dress or behaviour, can bring down on the head of an erring teenager the unqualified disapproval of his gang. Is this attitude valid? The film cites the case of a thirteen year old boy who has developed an interest in collecting butterflies - a hobby that his friends laugh at. Should he pursue his genuine interest, or should he conform?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julia Murphy, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: One man's opinion
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “What Do You Think”.
First in a series of discussion-provoking subjects, this film shows how one person’s judgment might reasonably run counter to the majority opinion. This is illustrated in a high-school classroom where a campaign is under way to raise funds for a school project. One student, although he believes in the cause, withholds his support because he disapproves of the high-pressure methods which put individuals on the spot if they are unable to or do not wish to contribute. The audience is asked for their appraisal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gudrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Majority vote
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “What Do You Think”.
A film designed to provoke discussion on the question of whether the elected representative of a group may legitimately support a measure which is disliked by the majority of electors. A situation is presented in which a class of high-school students voice their disapproval of the support given by their student council representative to a measure curtailing their extracurricular activities. In defending her action the representative gives adequate reasons for her support of the measure. The audience is invited to express its opinions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gudrun Parker and National Film Board of Canada
